intro: Oldenlandia balfourii, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Oldenlandia balfourii is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics.
